meanings.definition: The act of shortening or condensing a written work.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading abridgements because they are shorter and easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to summarize the story as an abridgement for our presentation.
meanings.sent3: The abridgements of the novel made it seem like a whole new story!
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was like an abridgement of a long book, cutting out all the unnecessary details.
meanings.sent5: The abridgements of the play highlighted the most important scenes.

meanings.definition: A shortened version of a written work.
meanings.sent1: The library had many abridgements of classic novels for students to read.
meanings.sent2: I bought the abridgement of the textbook to save time studying.
meanings.sent3: The abridgement of the movie was so short, it felt like a trailer!
meanings.sent4: His speech was like an abridgement of a long essay, getting straight to the point.
meanings.sent5: The abridgement of the article left out important details.
